item.title: Deploying an S3 static website with CDK for Terraform on Cloudfront vs Cloudflare
item.description: This tutorial shows what I did to setup and deploy an example static website on Cloudflare and Amazon Cloudfront using Terraform (CDK, Typescript)
item.content:encoded:
This tutorial shows what I did to setup and deploy an example static website on Cloudflare and Amazon Cloudfront using Terraform (CDK, Typescript)

Cloudflare and Cloudfront are similar CDN, DNS and load balancing providers that can help host your API or website and make it more available. Despite their similarity, setting them up with an S3 Hosted static website is obviously different.

In this tutorial, I'll give some code snippets and pointers on how to set up the bare working minimum for each. The rest like more secure S3 Policies, hosting directly on Cloudflare or using an on-premise hosted website instead of an S3 Bucket will be up to the reader.

Prerequisites​

Make sure to have cdktf, terraform, node, npm, react installed on your system.


Initializing the project and folder structure​

Folder structure is as follows:

cloudflare-example
├── README.md
├── index.ts
├── lib
│   ├── backend.ts
│   ├── provider.ts
│   ├── test
│   │   ├── cloudflare-test.ts
│   │   ├── cloudfront-test.ts
│   │   └── index.ts
│   └── web
│       ├── README.md
│       ├── build
│       ├── node_modules
│       ├── package-lock.json
│       ├── package.json
│       ├── public
│       └── src
├── package-lock.json
├── package.json
├── jest.config.js
└── tsconfig.json

'web' folder can be initialized using:

$ cd lib
$ npm i -g create-react-app
$ create-react-app web
$ cd web
$ npm run build

The root folder can be initialized with:

$ cdktf init

The rest needs to be created.


Boilerplate code to start with​

First, get provider dependencies by running:

$ cdktf get

The dependencies will be store in the directory '.gen' under root folder of the project.

Let's now create our main -- index.ts in the root folder, from which the Terraform app can run:​

index.ts
import * as dotenv from 'dotenv'
import { App } from 'cdktf'
import { TestStack } from './lib/test'

dotenv.config()

const app = new App()

new TestStack(app, 'test')

app.synth()

And then the index.ts in 'lib' where we define our Terraform Stack:​

First, the dependencies are as such:

/lib/index.ts
import { TerraformStack } from 'cdktf'
import { Construct } from 'constructs'
import { MyBackend } from '../backend'
import { MyProvider } from '../provider'
import { CloudflareTest } from './cloudflare-test'
import { CloudfrontTest } from './cloudfront-test'
import { CloudflareProvider } from '../../.gen/providers/cloudflare/provider'

export interface TestStackProps {
  region?: string
}

We define several providers (this can also be done in providers.ts) because we use AWS S3 to host our files and Cloudflare as a standalone provider for DNS and CDN:

/lib/index.ts
export class TestStack extends TerraformStack {
  constructor(scope: Construct, id: string, props?: TestStackProps) {
    super(scope, id)

    // defining providers
    new AwsProvider(this, 'provider', {
      profile: process.env.AWS_PROFILE,
      region: props?.region,
    })
    new CloudflareProvider(this, 'cloudflare-provider', {
      apiToken: '<YOUR_API_TOKEN>',
    })

    // enabling backend
    MyBackend.of(this, id)

    // ---

    const acmCertificateArn = '<YOUR ACM CERTIFICATE ARN>'

    new CloudfrontTest(this, 'adil-s3-test', {
      domain: '<YOUR PURCHASED DOMAIN NAME>',
      hostedZoneId: '<YOUR HOSTED ZONE ID>',
      acmCertificateArn,
    })

    new CloudflareTest(this, 'cloudflare-test', {
      domain: '<YOUR PURCHASED DOMAIN NAME>',
    })
  }
}
  • To get some of the credentials and other values like \<YOUR_API_TOKEN>, refer to the Using Cloudflare section down below

Using Cloudflare​

Additional prerequisites​

Make sure you have purchased a domain name that you can use to set up a Cloudflare site.

Getting an API Token​

Go to Cloudflare Dashboard and click 'My Profile' on the top right corner of the page.

Then, go to API Tokens and click 'Create Token'.

Create a custom API Token with the following rules:

You can then use that token for CloudflareProvider initialization in the code snippet above

Setting up S3 bucket hosting​

Here we have to make sure our bucket is reachable, thus we set its ACL rule as 'public-read' and security policy to allow PublicReadGetObject as in the code snippet below:

/lib/cloudflare-test.ts
const s3_bucket = new S3Bucket(this, 's3-bucket', {
  bucket: props.domain,
})

new S3BucketAcl(this, 's3-bucket-acl', {
  bucket: s3_bucket.bucket,
  acl: 'public-read',
})

new S3BucketPolicy(this, 's3-bucket-policy', {
  bucket: s3_bucket.bucket,
  policy: `{
        "Version": "2012-10-17",
        "Statement": [
          {
            "Sid": "PublicReadGetObject",
            "Effect": "Allow",
            "Principal": "*",
            "Action": [
              "s3:GetObject"
            ],
            "Resource": [
              "arn:aws:s3:::${props.domain}/*"
            ]
          }
        ]
      }`,
})

// Static Website Hosting
const website_сonfiguration = new S3BucketWebsiteConfiguration(this, 's3-website-configuration', {
  bucket: s3_bucket.bucket,
  indexDocument: { suffix: 'index.html' },
  errorDocument: { key: 'index.html' },
})

Then, we enable website hosting. Note, in older versions of hashicorp/aws provider all of these configurations can be done using just the 'S3Bucket' object. In the latest versions, ACL, policy and other settings for the bucket have to be defined separately.


Uploading static website files to S3 as S3 Objects​

/lib/cloudflare-test.ts
// Get all the files from build folder, skip directories
const files = glob.sync('./lib/web/build/**/*', { absolute: false, nodir: true })

// Create bucket object for each file
for (const file of files) {
  new S3Object(this, `aws_s3_bucket_object_${path.basename(file)}`, {
    dependsOn: [s3_bucket], // Wait untill the bucket is not created
    key: file.replace(`./lib/web/build/`, ''), // Using relative path for folder structure on S3
    bucket: props.domain,
    source: path.resolve(file), // Using absolute path to upload
    etag: `${Date.now()}`,
    contentType: mime.contentType(path.extname(file)) || undefined, // Set the content-type for each object
  })
}

*Note: Here a dependsOn parameter is used to wait for the bucket to be created before starting upload. Also, make sure to change the Terraform name of each S3Object accordingly.


Adding Cloudflare CDN Records​

Then, we add a CNAME record to Cloudflare pointing to that S3 Bucket URL that is now publicly available (and www just in case):

/lib/cloudflare-test.ts
new CloudflareRecord(this, 'cloudflare-record-naked', {
  zoneId: '2cdf31b7a1cd506ef0307f912181bfdc',
  name: props.domain,
  value: website_сonfiguration.websiteEndpoint,
  type: 'CNAME',
  ttl: 1,
  proxied: true,
})

new CloudflareRecord(this, 'cloudflare-record-www', {
  zoneId: '2cdf31b7a1cd506ef0307f912181bfdc',
  name: 'www',
  value: props.domain,
  type: 'CNAME',
  ttl: 1,
  proxied: true,
})

That's it. After running:

$ cdktf deploy

The static website should now be available via your purchased domain


Using Amazon CloudFront​

Setting up an S3 Bucket​


Before we configure the bucket, we need Cloudfront Origin Access Identity to then use that in our bucket's IAM policy configuration:

/lib/cloudfront-test.ts
const cloudfront_origin_access_identity = new CloudfrontOriginAccessIdentity(
  this,
  'cloudfront-origin-access-identity',
  { comment: props.domain }
)

This time the bucket can be made private and without website configuration:

/lib/cloudfront-test.ts
const s3_bucket = new S3Bucket(this, 's3-bucket', {
  bucket: props.domain,
})

new S3BucketAcl(this, 's3-bucket-acl', {
  bucket: s3_bucket.bucket,
  acl: 'private',
})

new S3BucketPolicy(this, 's3-bucket-policy', {
  bucket: s3_bucket.bucket,
  policy: `{
        "Version": "2012-10-17",
        "Statement": [
          {
            "Sid": "PublicReadGetObject",
            "Effect": "Allow",
            "Principal": {
              "AWS": "arn:aws:iam::cloudfront:user/CloudFront Origin Access Identity ${cloudfront_origin_access_identity.id}"
            },
            "Action": [
              "s3:GetObject"
            ],
            "Resource": [
              "arn:aws:s3:::${props.domain}/*"
            ]
          }
        ]
      }`,
})

Then, we add objects to the bucket in the same manner as with Cloudflare

After which, the Cloudfront distribution is configured as such:

/lib/cloudfront-test.ts
const cloudfront_distribution = new CloudfrontDistribution(this, `aws_cloudfront_${props.domain}`, {
  enabled: true,
  dependsOn: [s3_bucket],
  defaultRootObject: 'index.html',
  aliases: [props.domain],
  customErrorResponse: [
    {
      errorCode: 404,
      responseCode: 200,
      responsePagePath: '/index.html',
    },
  ],
  origin: [
    {
      originId: originId,
      domainName: s3_bucket.bucketDomainName,
      s3OriginConfig: {
        originAccessIdentity: cloudfront_origin_access_identity.cloudfrontAccessIdentityPath,
      },
    },
  ],
  defaultCacheBehavior: {
    allowedMethods: ['GET', 'HEAD'],
    cachedMethods: ['GET', 'HEAD'],
    forwardedValues: {
      cookies: { forward: 'none' },
      queryString: false,
    },
    targetOriginId: originId,
    viewerProtocolPolicy: 'allow-all',
  },
  restrictions: {
    geoRestriction: {
      restrictionType: 'none',
    },
  },
  viewerCertificate: {
    // *.glassdome.cloud 인증서
    acmCertificateArn: props.acmCertificateArn,
    minimumProtocolVersion: 'TLSv1.2_2021',
    sslSupportMethod: 'sni-only',
  },
})
  • Note: It's important to add 'aliases' field for your domain to work.

After that, we need to create an A Record in Route 53 as such:

/lib/cloudfront-test.ts
new Route53Record(this, 'route53-record', {
  zoneId: props.hostedZoneId,
  type: 'A',
  name: props.domain,
  alias: [
    {
      name: cloudfront_distribution.domainName,
      zoneId: cloudfront_distribution.hostedZoneId,
      evaluateTargetHealth: false,
    },
  ],
})

This will ensure the domain name works and points to the correct content.

Conclusion​

As you might have noticed, the Cloudfront is slightly easier to set-up safely without exposing S3 Bucket URL to the public. However, Cloudflare might offer other additional safety and performance benefits after careful set up. For this tutorial, we only focused on the bare working minimum, so that'll do for now.

Thank you for reading.

item.title: Installing Clickhouse on Kubernetes Hosted by NCloud and NHN Cloud
item.description: This is a walkthrough of what I did to setup clickhouse databases on Kubernetes
item.content:encoded:
This is a walkthrough of what I did to setup clickhouse databases on Kubernetes

Intro to Clickhouse​

Clickhouse is a column-oriented database management system (DBMS) for online analytical processing of queries (OLAP).

Clickhouse has great performance and can fufill our query needs at Glassdome. We were using Google Bigquery to fufill our databse needs, but the costs were becoming too expensive as we were scaling up. We also adopted a service agnostic approach that prevented us from relying on any one of the service.

Installing Clickhouse onto Kubernetes Cluster with Helm​

We used the helm chart managed by TrueCharts to install Clickhouse.

We used the following values to configure Clickhouse

values.yaml
clickhouseDatabase: "<database name>"
clickhouseUsername: "<username>"
clickhousePassword: "<password>"

timezone: Asia/Seoul

service:
  main:
    ports:
      native:
        enabled: true
        port: 9000
        protocol: TCP
        targetPort: 9000

portal:
  enabled: false

ingress:
  main:
    enabled: false

Using the value file, we installed the helm release

upgrade.sh
helm repo add truecharts https://charts.truecharts.org
helm repo update

NAME="my-clickhouse"
NAMESPACE="clickhouse"
CHART="truecharts/clickhouse"
VERSION="1.0.41"

helm upgrade --install $NAME $CHART --values values.yaml --version $VERSION --namespace $NAMESPACE --create-namespace

Installing on NCloud hosted Kubernetes Cluster​

NCloud should have deployed a storage class so the instructions listed above should work

Installing on NHN Cloud​

NHN Cloud is not as well executed as NCloud so there are extra steps that we need before deploying the helm chart

Deploying a Storage Class​

Following the instructions on the NHN Cloud documentation for Storage Class we used the following command to create a storage class:

cat <<EOF | kubectl apply -f -
apiVersion: storage.k8s.io/v1
kind: StorageClass
metadata:
  name: csi-storageclass
provisioner: cinder.csi.openstack.org
volumeBindingMode: WaitForFirstConsumer
EOF

Modify Values of helm chart​

NHN Cloud Storage has a strange problem where we don't have proper permissions to access files in the container that the Clickhouse chart deploys.

This was quite frustrating because there was no documentation in the helm chart or in NHN Cloud documentation.

After a lot of trial and error, I got a configuration that was able to give the proper permissions to the container.

This is definitely not an ideal solution as it just gives root access to the container, but I could not find any other way to get it to work. Set the values as follows:

values-nhn.yaml
clickhouseDatabase: "<database name>"
clickhouseUsername: "<username>"
clickhousePassword: "<password>"

timezone: Asia/Seoul

service:
  main:
    ports:
      native:
        enabled: true
        port: 9000
        protocol: TCP
        targetPort: 9000

portal:
  enabled: false

ingress:
  main:
    enabled: false

securityContext:
  runAsGroup: 0
  runAsNonRoot: false
  runAsUser: 0

It adds the values for securityContext so it runs as root.

Install using values-nhn.yaml​

upgrade-nhn.yaml
helm repo add truecharts https://charts.truecharts.org
helm repo update

NAME="my-clickhouse"
NAMESPACE="clickhouse"
CHART="truecharts/clickhouse"
VERSION="1.0.41"

helm upgrade --install $NAME $CHART --values values-nhn.yaml --version $VERSION --namespace $NAMESPACE --create-namespace

Testing​

Follwing these steps, should result in a working Clickhouse database

We deployed another application that would send queries to the Clickhouse database onto the Kubernetes Cluster

Testing in Postman and on the actual production showed it works great

노트

I hope it was helpful. Thanks

item.title: Go Low Capacity Binary
item.description: Let's learn how to build a Go application with minimum capacity and deploy it as a container image.
item.content:encoded:
Let's learn how to build a Go application with minimum capacity and deploy it as a container image.

Dockerfile​

Dockerfile
FROM golang:alpine as builder
COPY . .
RUN apk update && \
  apk upgrade && \
  apk add --no-cache ca-certificates && \
  apk add --update-cache tzdata && \
  update-ca-certificates
RUN echo "nobody:x:65534:65534:nobody:/:" > /etc_passwd
ENV GO111MODULE=on
ENV CGO_ENABLED=0
ENV GOOS=linux
ENV GOARCH=amd64
WORKDIR /build
RUN go mod download
RUN go build -a -ldflags '-s' -o /main .

FROM scratch
COPY --from=builder /etc_passwd /etc/passwd
COPY --from=builder /etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt /etc/ssl/certs/
COPY --from=builder /usr/local/go/lib/time/zoneinfo.zip /
COPY --from=builder /main .
ENV ZONEINFO=/zoneinfo.zip
EXPOSE 8080
USER nobody
ENTRYPOINT ["./main"]

item.title: Discussion about Go Language and Project Structure
item.description: This is a discussion about the directory structure of Go applications.
item.content:encoded:
This is a discussion about the directory structure of Go applications.

Introduction to Go​

I got to know Go on the 2015 podcast "I'm a Programmer" episode "The Go Language Attraction of Google Engineers". Yeom Jae-hyun, who worked as a Google engineer, appeared on the show and talked about the Go language while publishing a book called "Discovery Go". And I did a little tutorial through a Go study group, but I haven't actually used Go in practice since.

Glassdome uses Go language to develop applications.

The Benefits of Go​

First off, Go is quite popular in the industry. It's a language that I believe will continue to be popular.

The syntax resembles C, which is learned in basically any school.

At the same time, it is easier to use than C. (obviously)

Furthermore, it performs better than VM or script engine-based languages.

Another advantage that I found was,

Go applications are statically compiled, minimizing runtime dependence, and are very small when built with a container image.

Empty container without even an OS can only be run by inserting the Go binary. Therefore, it takes less time to upload images when developing and deploying, and less time to download container images from the Kubernetes node and less time to prepare for execution.

Go Container Image Size

When you build a Web application server with JVM or NodeJS, no matter how small you try to make it, it can easily exceed 100MBs and even become hundreds of MBs. On the other hand, you can create a Go container of less than 10 MB even if you include all the packages you need.

Install Go​

팁

We recommend that you install it as a GVM.

gvm install go1.19

Go Project Structure​

Because Go syntax is easy, developers who have used other programming languages can adapt quickly.

But sometimes when looking at the code you might not know what to do.

For example, how do you capture the directory structure of the Go project?

Today I'm going to talk about this.

정보

The document you want to refer to is Standard Go Project Layout.

The Go Project is a Module​

Since Go 1.14, Go has had the the concept of a Module.

Before the Go Module came out, Go had a structure where dependency packages were gathered and installed in the same place the execution environment was installed (GOPATH); which is similar to Python.

정보

Similarly, if you do not use venv in Python the package is installed in the python installation path python-x.y.z/site-packages/.

But we don't need to go over old information, you can consider all the latest Go releases as using Go Modules.

Dependent packages are managed separately for each module.

정보

Go Module = Project (in other languages)

Getting Started with Go Module​

Let's make a module called mymodule.

mkdir mymodule
cd mymodule

go mod init github.com/glassdomeinc/mymodule

The file go.mod is created.

go.mod
module github.com/glassdomeinc/mymodule

go 1.19

No Separate src Directory, module is root package​

In JVM languages, including Java, the path that the compiler recognizes as a source code file is conventionally defined as src/main/java.

But instead of having that rule in Go, the Go module directory itself becomes the root package for that module.

If you look at many Go open source projects hosted on GitHub, you can see that the repository itself is a Go Module that contains the source code *.go directly in the root directory.

+ mymodule/
+-- go.mod
+-- go.sum
+-- README.md
+-- myfile.go

You can also put the go.mod and source code *.go files side by side in the module root directory.

myfile.go
package mymodule

func Xxx() {
  ...
}

The main package (entry point code) is located under the cmd/ directory​

main.go
package main

func main() {
  ...
}

The entry point code for the Go application is written in a reserved package called main. However, the main package cannot be placed in the same directory as any other generic package. If you place main.go in the root path of the module, it will take away the root package digits (most importantly) where the other source code files will fit.

Therefore, main.go is placed in the cmd/ directory instead of the module's root path.

+ mymodule/
+-+ cmd/
| +-- main.go
+-- go.mod
+-- go.sum
+-- README.md
+-- myfile.go

(We don't really execute this well) If there are multiple entry points, place them in each subdirectory under cmd/.

주의

There can only be 0~1 main in each directory

+ mymodule/
+-+ cmd/
| +-+ main1
| | +-- main.go
| +-+ main2
|   +-- main.go
+-- go.mod
+-- go.sum
+-- README.md
+-- myfile.go
주의

Work in Progress 🚧

item.title: Go 언어와 프로젝트 구조에 관한 이야기
item.description: Go 애플리케이션의 디렉터리 구조에 관한 이야기입니다.
item.content:encoded:
Go 애플리케이션의 디렉터리 구조에 관한 이야기입니다.

Go 언어와의 만남​

제가 Go를 알게 된 것은 2015년 팟캐스트 "나는 프로그래머다" 에피소드 "구글 엔지니어가 말하는 Go언어의 매력"에서였습니다. Google 엔지니어로 일했던 염재현 님이 "디스커버리 Go"라는 책을 내면서 방송에 출연해 Go 언어에 관해 이야기를 해주었습니다. 그리고 Go 스터디 그룹을 통해 튜토리얼을 조금 해보았습니다만, 그후로 사실상 실무적으로 Go를 사용한 적은 없었습니다.

글래스돔에서는 애플리케이션 개발에 Go 언어를 사용하고 있습니다.

Go 언어의 장점​

Go언어는 일단 업계에서 인기가 많습니다. 앞으로도 잘 나갈 언어라는 것입니다.

코드 문법은 어느 학교에서도 기본적으로 다 배우는 C언어를 닮았습니다.

그러면서도 C 보다 사용하기 좋습니다. (당연한 말이지만)

그리고 VM이나 스크립트 엔진 기반 언어보다 성능이 더 좋습니다.

또 제가 발견한 또 한가지 장점은,

Go 애플리케이션은 정적으로 컴파일되어 실행시간 의존성을 최소화하여 컨테이너 이미지로 빌드했을 때 크기가 아주 작게 나옵니다.

OS 조차 없는 빈 컨테이너에 Go 바이너리만 집어넣어서 실행하는 게 가능합니다. 그래서 개발하고 배포할 때 이미지 업로드 시간이 적게 들고, Kubernetes 노드에서 컨테이너 이미지를 다운로드 하는 시간과 실행 준비 시간도 적게 듭니다.

Go 컨테이너 이미지 크기

JVM이나 NodeJS가 들어간 웹 애플리케이션 서버를 빌드하면, 아무리 작게 만들려고 해도 100MB가 쉽게 넘어가고 심지어 수백 MB가 되는 경우도 있습니다. 그런데 Go 컨테이너는 필요한 패키지를 다 포함해도 10MB 미만으로 생성할 수 있습니다.

Go 설치​

팁

GVM으로 설치하는 게 좋습니다.

gvm install go1.19

Go 프로젝트 구조​

Go 문법은 쉽기 때문에 다른 프로그래밍 언어를 사용해본 개발자들은 금방 적응할 수 있습니다.

하지만 코드 외 부분들은 Go에서는 어떻게 해야하는지 궁금할 때가 있습니다.

예를 들면 Go 프로젝트의 디렉터리 구조를 어떻게 잡아야 하는 것들이 있지요.

오늘은 이에 관해 얘기해보겠습니다.

정보

참고할 문서는 Standard Go Project Layout입니다.

Go 프로젝트는 모듈이다​

Go 1.14부터 Go에는 Module이라는 개념이 생겼습니다.

Go Module이 나오기 전의 Go는 Python과 같이 기본적으로 실행 환경이 설치된 곳(GOPATH)에 의존 패키지가 모여서 설치되는 구조였습니다.

정보

Python에서도 마찬가지로 venv를 사용하지 않는 경우, python 설치 경로 python-x.y.z/site-packages/에 패키지가 설치됩니다.

하지만 지금에서는 옛날 이야기를 할 필요는 없고, 그냥 요즘 나오는 Go는 모두 다 Go Module이라고 보면 됩니다.

각 모듈마다 의존 패키지는 따로 관리됩니다.

정보

Go Module = (다른 언어에서의) 프로젝트

Go Module 시작하기​

mymodule이라는 모듈을 만들어보겠습니다.

mkdir mymodule
cd mymodule

go mod init github.com/glassdomeinc/mymodule

go.mod 파일이 생성됩니다.

go.mod
module github.com/glassdomeinc/mymodule

go 1.19

src 디렉터리가 따로 없고, 모듈이 루트 패키지​

Java를 비롯한 JVM 계열 언어들은 컴파일러가 소스코드 파일로 인식하는 경로가 src/main/java 등으로 관습적으로 정해져있습니다.

하지만 Go에는 그런 규칙은 없는 대신, Go 모듈 디렉터리 자체가 곧 그 모듈의 루트 패키지가 됩니다.

GitHub에 호스팅된 많은 Go 오픈소스 프로젝트를 보면 저장소 자체가 Go Module이고 루트 디렉터리에 *.go 소스코드가 바로 있는 것을 확인할 수 있습니다.

+ mymodule/
+-- go.mod
+-- go.sum
+-- README.md
+-- myfile.go

이렇게 모듈 루트 디렉터리에 go.mod와 소스코드 *.go 파일을 나란히 넣어도 됩니다.

myfile.go
package mymodule

func Xxx() {
  ...
}

main 패키지(진입점 코드)은 cmd/ 디렉터리 아래에​

main.go
package main

func main() {
  ...
}

Go 애플리케이션의 진입점 코드는 main이라는 예약된 패키지에 작성합니다. 그런데 main 패키지는 다른 일반 패키지와 같은 디렉터리 내에 배치할 수 없습니다. main.go를 모듈의 루트 경로에 배치해버리면 다른 소스코드 파일이 들어갈 루트 패키지 자리(가장 중요한 곳)를 뺏는 모양이 됩니다.

그래서 main.go는 모듈의 루트 경로 대신 cmd/ 디렉터리에 배치합니다.

+ mymodule/
+-+ cmd/
| +-- main.go
+-- go.mod
+-- go.sum
+-- README.md
+-- myfile.go

(우리는 이렇게 잘 사용하지는 않지만) 만약 진입점이 여러 개면, cmd/ 아래 서브 디렉터리에 각각 배치합니다.

주의

한 디렉터리에 main 패키지는 0~1개만 존재해야 합니다.

+ mymodule/
+-+ cmd/
| +-+ main1
| | +-- main.go
| +-+ main2
|   +-- main.go
+-- go.mod
+-- go.sum
+-- README.md
+-- myfile.go
주의

작성중입니다 🚧

item.title: Installing NodeJS with NVM
item.description: NVM is a tool that allows you to install multiple versions of NodeJS and replace them as needed.
item.content:encoded:
NVM is a tool that allows you to install multiple versions of NodeJS and replace them as needed.

TypeScript and NodeJS​

The following programming languages are commonly used in Glassdome:

  • Software Development Team
    • Backend Server Application Development: Go
    • Frontend Client Web Application Development: TypeScript
  • Infra Team: Go, TypeScript
  • AI/Data Team: Python

Among them, the Infra team needs a scripting language for cloud development and infrastructure management, mainly using TypeScript.

NodeJS is required to run TypeScript so NodeJS must be installed first.

NVM (Node Version Manager)​

NVM is a tool that allows you to install multiple versions of NodeJS and replace them as needed.

팁

Similarly, Go has GVM) that installs and manages multiple versions.

Let's assume the following circumstances:

  • Use Node 16 for AWS Lambda Function
  • Use Node 17 when developing front-end web applications
  • Server applications use Node 18

Because you have to install multiple versions on one PC, upgrade or patch versions, and switch between them it would be very inconvenient to simply install one version.

주의

So I don't recommend following the download and installation instructions on the NodeJS website.

It is more convenient to use NVM to install NodeJS and manage the version.

How to Install​

정보

Install & Update Script

  • curl
  • wget
curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.39.2/install.sh | bash
wget -qO- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.39.2/install.sh | bash

You can use either curl or wget

주의

The version keeps changing, so please check the latest version then. (Version 0.39.2 as of October 2022)

Shell Configuration Settings​

팁

When you install nvm, follow the instructions that are printed on the console.

  • bash
  • zsh
echo 'export NVM_DIR="$HOME/.nvm"' >> ~/.bashrc
echo '[ -s "/usr/local/opt/nvm/nvm.sh" ] && . "/usr/local/opt/nvm/nvm.sh"  # This loads nvm' >> ~/.bashrc
echo '[ -s "/usr/local/opt/nvm/etc/bash_completion.d/nvm" ] && . "/usr/local/opt/nvm/etc/bash_completion.d/nvm"  # This loads nvm bash_completion' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'export NVM_DIR="$HOME/.nvm"' >> ~/.zshrc
echo '[ -s "/usr/local/opt/nvm/nvm.sh" ] && . "/usr/local/opt/nvm/nvm.sh"  # This loads nvm' >> ~/.zshrc
echo '[ -s "/usr/local/opt/nvm/etc/bash_completion.d/nvm" ] && . "/usr/local/opt/nvm/etc/bash_completion.d/nvm"  # This loads nvm bash_completion' >> ~/.zshrc
주의

After that, shut down the terminal completely (⌘+Q) and run it again. Especially if the VSCode is running, you must shut down the VCode completely (⌘+Q), restart the terminal, and then restart the VSCode.

Confirm Installation​

Type the following on the command line:

command -v nvm

This output indicates that the installation is correct.

nvm

.nvmrc Settings File​

팁

It is a method of managing NodeJS versions used between multiple projects so that they do not get tangled.

What version of NodeJS execution environment should be used for each project?'.You can save it to an nvmrc` file and put it in the code store for use.

lambda/.nvmrc
16.18.0
webapp/.nvmrc
17.9.1
server/.nvmrc
18.12.0

If there are a lot of projects,

각 개발자가 프로젝트를 clone 한 다음 해당 프로젝트의 루트 경로(.nvmrc 파일이 있는 위치)에서 Each developer should clone a project in the root path of that project (where the '.nvmrc' file is located)

$ nvm install
$ nvm use

This will set the corresponding NodeJS execution environment.

Install the Latest NodeJSLTS Version​

nvm install --lts

The --lts option installs (or upgrades) the latest Long-Term Support (LTS) version

노트

I hope it was helpful. Thank you.

References​

  • Node Version Manager - POSIX-compliant bash script to manage multiple active node.js versions

item.title: NVM으로 NodeJS 설치하기
item.description: NVM은 여러 버전의 NodeJS를 설치해두고, 필요에 따라 여러 버전을 바꿔가면서 사용할 수 있도록 도와주는 도구입니다.
item.content:encoded:
NVM은 여러 버전의 NodeJS를 설치해두고, 필요에 따라 여러 버전을 바꿔가면서 사용할 수 있도록 도와주는 도구입니다.

TypeScript와 NodeJS​

글래스돔에서 많이 사용하는 프로그래밍 언어는 다음과 같습니다.

  • SW개발팀
    • Backend 서버 애플리케이션 개발: Go
    • Frontend 클라이언트 웹 애플리케이션 개발: TypeScript
  • Infra팀: Go, TypeScript
  • AI/Data팀: Python

그중에서 Infra팀은 클라우드 개발과 인프라 관리에 스크립트 언어가 필요한데, TypeScript를 주로 사용하고 있습니다.

TypeScript를 실행하기 위해서는 NodeJS가 필요하기 때문에 먼저 NodeJS를 설치해야 합니다.

NVM (Node Version Manager)​

NVM은 여러 버전의 NodeJS를 설치해두고, 필요에 따라 여러 버전을 바꿔가면서 사용할 수 있도록 도와주는 도구입니다.

팁

비슷하게 Go도 여러 버전을 설치하고 관리해주는 GVM이 있습니다.

이런 경우를 가정해보겠습니다.

  • AWS Lambda Function에는 Node 16 사용
  • 프론트엔드 웹 애플리케이션을 개발할 때는 Node 17 사용
  • 서버 애플리케이션에서는 Node 18을 사용

한 PC에서도 여러 버전이 설치되어야 하고, 또 때때로 버전 업그레이드나 패치도 해줘야 하고, 바꿔가면서 사용해야 하기 때문에 단순히 한 가지 버전만 설치하는 방법만으로는 매우 불편할 것입니다.

주의

그래서 NodeJS 홈페이지에 들어가서 다운로드 받아서 설치하는 방법은 추천하지 않습니다.

이럴 떄 NVM을 사용해서 NodeJS를 설치하고 버전을 관리하면 편리합니다.

설치 방법​

정보

Install & Update Script

  • curl
  • wget
curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.39.2/install.sh | bash
wget -qO- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.39.2/install.sh | bash

curl, wget 둘 중 아무 거나 하면 됩니다.

주의

버전은 계속 바뀌니까 그때그때 최신 버전을 확인해주세요. (2022년 10월 현재 버전 0.39.2)

쉘 환경 설정​

팁

nvm을 설치할 때 콘솔에 출력되는 방법대로 따라하면 됩니다.

  • bash
  • zsh
echo 'export NVM_DIR="$HOME/.nvm"' >> ~/.bashrc
echo '[ -s "/usr/local/opt/nvm/nvm.sh" ] && . "/usr/local/opt/nvm/nvm.sh"  # This loads nvm' >> ~/.bashrc
echo '[ -s "/usr/local/opt/nvm/etc/bash_completion.d/nvm" ] && . "/usr/local/opt/nvm/etc/bash_completion.d/nvm"  # This loads nvm bash_completion' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'export NVM_DIR="$HOME/.nvm"' >> ~/.zshrc
echo '[ -s "/usr/local/opt/nvm/nvm.sh" ] && . "/usr/local/opt/nvm/nvm.sh"  # This loads nvm' >> ~/.zshrc
echo '[ -s "/usr/local/opt/nvm/etc/bash_completion.d/nvm" ] && . "/usr/local/opt/nvm/etc/bash_completion.d/nvm"  # This loads nvm bash_completion' >> ~/.zshrc
주의

하고 나면 터미널을 완전히 종료(⌘+Q)하고 다시 실행해주세요. 특히 VSCode가 실행중이라면, VScode를 완전히 종료하고(⌘+Q) 터미널을 재시작한 후에 VSCode를 재시작해주어야 합니다.

설치 확인​

명령줄에 아래와 같이 입력합니다.

command -v nvm

이렇게 출력되면 설치가 올바르게 된 것입니다.

nvm

.nvmrc 설정 파일​

팁

여러 프로젝트 간에 사용하는 NodeJS 버전이 엉키지 않도록 관리해주는 방법입니다.

각 프로젝트 마다 어떤 버전의 NodeJS 실행 환경을 사용해야 하는지를 .nvmrc 파일에 저장해놓고 코드 저장소에 올려놓고 사용할 수 있습니다.

lambda/.nvmrc
16.18.0
webapp/.nvmrc
17.9.1
server/.nvmrc
18.12.0

이렇게 여러 프로젝트가 있다면,

각 개발자가 프로젝트를 clone 한 다음 해당 프로젝트의 루트 경로(.nvmrc 파일이 있는 위치)에서

$ nvm install
$ nvm use

해주면 해당 NodeJS 실행 환경으로 설정됩니다.

최신 NodeJS LTS 버전 설치하기​

nvm install --lts

--lts 옵션을 붙이면 최신 LTS(Long-Term Support) 버전을 설치(혹은 업그레이드) 합니다.

노트

도움이 되셨길 바랍니다. 감사합니다.

References​

  • Node Version Manager - POSIX-compliant bash script to manage multiple active node.js versions

item.title: 리눅스에서도 homebrew 사용하기
item.content:encoded:
homebrew는 macOS의 패키지 관리자입니다.

덕분에 필요한 패키지를 간단한 명령어로 쉽게 설치할 수 있습니다.

item.title: Windows on Linux: WSL2
item.content:encoded:
WSL2: Windows Subsystem for Linux 2​

WSL stands for "Windows Subsystem for Linux", a tool that makes Linux available to Windows.

Before WSL came out, we used [Cygwin] (https://www.cygwin.com/)) or a method of installing a Linux distribution (such as Ubuntu) as a VM on a PC. Cygwin is not a complete Linux implementation, however, and installing Linux as a VM is costly. Instead, WSL makes it convenient for Windows to use Linux.

Advantages of WSL​

WSL2 allows Windows PC users to have the same user experience as they do with the Darwin operating system. Installing and using WSL has the following advantages:

  • You can easily install the tools you need by using a package manager such as homebrew.
  • In many cases, you can quickly solve any problems using linux shell commands

Above all, when documenting any troubleshooting method, Windows users and macOS users do not have to write separate solutions which optimizes the team's communication and development productivity.

Disadvantages of WSL​

WSL is different from the actual Linux distribution and cannot be used for servers. (systemd not supported)

Instead, there is virtually no downside for us to use PCs.

How to install​

Open PowerShell with administrator privileges

wsl --install

This will install (based on Windows 11)

  • [English] Install Linux on Windows with WSL
  • [한국어] WSL을 사용하여 Windows에 Linux 설치

More: Windows Terminal​

It is better to run the shell using Windows Terminal provided by Windows than to run the WSL distribution directly (for example, Ubuntu).

Use shortcuts, such as copy-paste, which are more compatible with other programs, and the interface is convenient.

정보

[Microsoft Apps] Windows Terminal

Thanks for reading!

item.title: Windows에서도 Linux를: WSL2
item.content:encoded:
WSL2: Windows Subsystem for Linux 2​

WSL은 "Windows Subsystem for Linux"의 약자로, Windows에서 Linux를 사용할 수 있게 하는 도구입니다.

WSL이 나오기 전에는 Cygwin이나, VM으로 리눅스 배포판(Ubuntu 등)을 PC에 설치하는 방법을 사용했습니다. 하지만 Cygwin으로는 온전한 리눅스 구현이 안 되고, VM으로 리눅스를 설치하는 방법은 비용이 많이 들어갑니다. 대신 WSL을 사용하면 Windows에서 편리하게 Linux를 사용할 수 있습니다.

WSL의 장점​

WSL2은 Windows PC 사용자가, 맥(darwin 운영체제)에서와 같은 사용자 경험을 갖게 해줍니다. WSL을 설치해서 사용하면 다음과 같은 장점이 있습니다.

  • homebrew 같은 패키지 관리자를 사용해서 필요한 도구를 손쉽게 설치할 수 있다.
  • 많은 경우 문제의 해결 방법이 되는 unix 쉘 명령어를 바로 사용할 수 있다.

무엇보다도 어떤 문제 해결 방법을 공유할 때, Windows 사용자 따로 macOS 사용자 따로 각각 방법을 기술하지 않아도 되므로 팀의 정보 공유 효율과 개발 생산성이 올라갑니다.

WSL의 단점​

WSL은 실제 리눅스 배포판과 달라서 서버용으로는 쓸 수 없습니다. (특히 systemd 지원 안 됨)

대신 우리가 PC용으로 쓰기에는 사실상 단점이 없습니다.

설치 방법​

PowerShell을 관리자 권한으로 열고,

wsl --install

하면 설치됩니다. (Windows 11 기준)

  • [English] Install Linux on Windows with WSL
  • [한국어] WSL을 사용하여 Windows에 Linux 설치

추가: Windows Terminal​

WSL 배포판(예를 들면, Ubuntu 등)을 직접 실행하는 것 보다는 윈도우에서 제공하는 Windows Terminal을 사용해서 쉘을 실행하면 더 좋습니다.

복사-붙여넣기 등 단축키 사용 및 다른 프로그램과의 호환성이 더 좋고 인터페이스가 편리합니다.

정보

[Microsoft Apps] Windows Terminal

감사합니다.
